Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word bear.
choices: A tropical fruit / To dance
A small insect / To sleep deeply
A type of fish / To run quickly
A large furry animal / To carry or hold something, or to tolerate

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word wave.
choices: Water moving in the ocean / To move your hand to say hello or goodbye
A type of cloud / To run fast
A type of tree / To jump high
A musical note / To eat quickly

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word bat.
choices: A type of hat / A swimming fish
A stick used to hit a ball in sports / A flying animal that comes out at night
A cooking utensil / A farm animal
A musical instrument / A type of bird

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word bark.
choices: A root of a plant / The sound a fish makes
The outer covering of a tree / The sound a dog makes
A type of flower / The sound a cat makes
A leaf from a plant / The sound a bird makes

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word ring.
choices: A type of hat / The sound of clapping
Jewelry worn on a finger / The sound a phone or bell makes
A bracelet / The sound of wind
A necklace / The sound of rain

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word light.
choices: A type of sound / Very cold
Brightness from the sun or a lamp / Not heavy in weight
A strong smell / Very fast
Darkness at night / Very heavy

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word watch.
choices: A type of shoe / To listen to something
A hat for your head / To taste something
A small clock worn on your wrist / To look at something carefully
A ring for your finger / To smell something

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word fan.
choices: A cooking pot / A person who is sad
A type of chair / A person who is sleeping
A device that heats air / A person who dislikes something
A device that blows air to cool you / A person who really likes something or someone

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word play.
choices: To have fun with games or toys / A show performed on stage
To sleep at night / A type of food
To eat dinner / A type of animal
To take a bath / A type of flower

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word nail.
choices: A piece of tape / A tooth in your mouth
A piece of string / The soft part of your ear
A metal piece used to hold things together / The hard part at the end of your finger
A type of glue / A hair on your head

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word present.
choices: A type of food / The future time
A gift given to someone / The current time (not past or future)
Something you buy for yourself / The past time
A type of clothing / A specific day

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word bank.
choices: A place where you buy food / The middle of a lake
A place where you sleep / The top of a mountain
A place where you keep money / The land along a river
A place where you exercise / The bottom of the ocean

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word fall.
choices: To fly up in the air / The season called spring
To drop down to the ground / The season between summer and winter (autumn)
To stand still / The season called summer
To run fast / The season called winter

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word leaves.
choices: Green parts that grow on trees and plants / To go away from a place
The flowers on a bush / To sit down
The bark of a tree / To stay in one spot
The roots of a tree / To arrive at a place

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word trunk.
choices: The main stem of a tree / A large box for storing things, or an elephant's nose
The roots of a tree / A cat's tail
The flowers of a tree / A dog's ear
The leaves of a tree / A small bag for coins

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word pitcher.
choices: A cup for drinking / The player who hits the ball
A plate for food / The player who catches the ball
A bowl for soup / The player who runs bases
A container for pouring liquids / The player who throws the ball in baseball

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word cold.
choices: A medium temperature / A cut on your skin
A high temperature, very hot / A broken bone
A perfect temperature / A bump on your head
A low temperature, not warm / An illness that makes you sneeze and cough

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word kind.
choices: Being mean to others / A color of something
Being nice and helpful to others / A type or category of something
Being loud around others / A shape of something
Being shy around others / A size of something

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word fair.
choices: Being unkind to people / A school building
Treating people differently / A place to buy groceries
Ignoring other people / A hospital
Treating everyone equally / An outdoor event with rides and games

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word tie.
choices: Clothing worn around the neck / To fasten with a knot, or when scores are equal
Clothing worn on hands / To open a door
Clothing worn on feet / To cut with scissors
Clothing worn on head / To break something

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word seal.
choices: A sea animal with flippers / To close something tightly
A swimming fish / To drop something
A land animal with legs / To open something wide
A flying bird / To break something apart

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word match.
choices: A candle for light / Things that are opposite
A flashlight / Things that don't fit together
A small stick used to start fire / Things that go together or look the same
A large log for burning / Things that are very different

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word park.
choices: A road for cars / To fly an airplane
A public area with grass and trees / To stop and leave a car somewhere
A building with many floors / To drive a car fast
A swimming pool / To ride a bicycle

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word jam.
choices: A sweet spread made from fruit / To be stuck or crowded (like traffic jam)
A type of vegetable / To be empty and open
A salty spread for bread / To move freely and fast
A piece of meat / To fly through the air

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word change.
choices: Coins (money) you get back / To make something different
Paper money only / To keep something the same
A credit card / To destroy something
A check from the bank / To hide something

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word sink.
choices: A bathtub for soaking / To float on top of water
A shower / To climb up high
A toilet / To fly in the air
A basin for washing in kitchen or bathroom / To go down below water

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word duck.
choices: A farm animal that moos / To run very fast
A bird that sings in trees / To jump up high
A fish that swims in ocean / To stand very tall
A bird that swims and quacks / To bend down quickly to avoid something

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word letter.
choices: An email / A color (like red, blue)
A phone call / A number (like 1, 2, 3)
A text message / A shape (like circle, square)
A written message sent to someone / A symbol in the alphabet (like A, B, C)

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word rock.
choices: A hard stone from the ground / To move back and forth gently
Green grass from a field / To jump up and down
Soft sand from the beach / To stand completely still
Wet mud from a puddle / To run very fast

Multiple Meaning Words.question: Describe two meanings for the word shell.
choices: The hard outer covering of some animals / The outer part of an egg or nut
The feathers of a bird / The yolk of an egg
The scales of a fish / The white of an egg
The soft fur of animals / The inside part of an egg
